alert.note: Alert for Franklin (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 6:02PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHWESTERN FRANKLIN COUNTY THROUGH 630 PM EDT... At 601 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Upper Arlington, moving southwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph, pea size hail, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Columbus, Dublin, Upper Arlington, Hilliard, Worthington, Ohio State University, Lake Darby, Grandview Heights, Valleyview, Marble Cliff, Riverlea, Clintonville, Georgesville, Lincoln Village and New Rome. This includes the following Interstates... I-70 in Ohio between mile markers 87 and 97. I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 110 and 114. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
